item.title: 2013 Zeitgeist
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: A somewhat random, mini-zeitgeist of interesting activity based on my 2013 spreadsheet. 2007 was the last time I did anything like this. So, 2013… numbers approximate… 173 days where I could commute to work (not sick, on holiday, traveling for work etc) 155 of them I did commute on bike at least one way (almost … Continue reading "2013 Zeitgeist"
item.content:encoded:
A somewhat random, mini-zeitgeist of interesting activity based on my 2013 spreadsheet. 2007 was the last time I did anything like this.

So, 2013… numbers approximate…

  • 173 days where I could commute to work (not sick, on holiday, traveling for work etc)
  • 155 of them I did commute on bike at least one way (almost all of them both ways) that’s almost 90% of the days (I’m almost surprised its not more…)
    • 94 of these on the Volpe, 61 on the 925
    • 38 of them were wet at least one way
  • I ran 44 times
  • I mountain biked a staggering 30 times (which for a father who doesn’t get out much and busted himself for two months is pretty good) – thank you Ecuador!
  • I boarded 12 times, mostly thanks to taking Lucy to ski lessons and killing time at Alpental
  • I swam about half a dozen times

All in all about 246 days of activity – I was aiming for 250 but frankly I’m happy, happy (and had such a lazy/inconvenient December) especially as this accommodated about 8 weeks business travel.

Now, about the mountain biking total for 2014 (and the New York Marathon 2014)….

item.title: 2008 Activity Summary
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: A very belated, and somewhat truncated, summary of my 2008 sporting activity courtesy of some spreadsheet crunching this weekend. In general, up from 2007, but as 1/4 of 2007 was untracked/Lucified I don’t think it’s that much of a difference. My days of doing nothing are down to about 131, which I am happy about, … Continue reading "2008 Activity Summary"
item.content:encoded:
A very belated, and somewhat truncated, summary of my 2008 sporting activity courtesy of some spreadsheet crunching this weekend.

In general, up from 2007, but as 1/4 of 2007 was untracked/Lucified I don’t think it’s that much of a difference.

My days of doing nothing are down to about 131, which I am happy about, although my mountain biking continues to suffer – work commuting and running count for most activities (and as I trained for and ran an ultra-marathon relay with Ragnar in 2008 the running part isn’t surprising).

The daily bike to work is quite astounding, and in terms of counts the round-trip counts as *1* (so the counts could be higher).

I do not think this year will be as impressive – we’re already car-shopping.

  2008 Miles 2008 Count 2007 Miles 2007 Count 2006 Miles 2006 Count 2005 Miles 2005 Count
Work Bike 1311 153 976 122 1498 124 2014 134
Other Bike 53 2 – 0 – 4 239 21
Mtn Bike – 3 – 5 77 12 – –
Run 435 81 311 54 163 41 230 42
Trail Run 15 2 – 0 – 5 51 6
Hike – 1 – 2 – 12 65 7
Snow – 3 – 1 0 12 – –
Other – 2 – 1 3 9 3 8
Nada – 131 – 208 0 153 – –
Total
(not nada)		 1814 247 1287 184 1751 219 2601 218

Shoe miles:

Shoe 2008 Miles Number Runs Average Miles
Blue Brooks 116 23 5.04
Cascadia (trail) 81 13 6.23
Red Brooks (deceased) 22 5 4.45
Yellow Brooks 226 42 5.39
Adrenaline Trail (semi-casual) 24 4 6.09

And bike commuting:

Bike 2008 Rides 2007 Rides 2006 Rides (*)
Volpe 86 62 32
Redlien 925 69 57 48

(*) only started tracking bikes midway through 2006 after Redline 925 was purchased so the mighty wet winter rides on the Volpe aren’t there – I think the trend is set that the 925 is the summer bike.

item.title: 2007 Activity Zeitgeist
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: Well its that time again where I’ve frittered away a couple of hours analyzing my activities log from last year. A change in format of the Excel spreadsheet was not that useful, and it’s actually taken longer to pull together the raw numbers than last year; and then it got a little too interesting when … Continue reading "2007 Activity Zeitgeist"
item.content:encoded:
Well its that time again where I’ve frittered away a couple of hours analyzing my activities log from last year.

A change in format of the Excel spreadsheet was not that useful, and it’s actually taken longer to pull together the raw numbers than last year; and then it got a little too interesting when I could go all anal over comparing the numbers to 2006 and 2005.

In preparation – this year sees a significant decrease in activities overall. My spreadsheet has no entries for 92 days from Lucy’s birth to Danika’s return to work (and I need to take the bike). Whether this was form-filling laziness or physical laziness is a mea culpa now. It is now fact. The only two increases are in running and the wonderful nada.

So here are the pies:

Because I run and bike on the same day, the real story (as told by the calendar) for nada is more shocking:

And the numbers, they do not lie (red is for less than 2006, green is for more):

  2007 Miles 2007 Count 2006 Miles 2006 Count 2005 Miles 2005 Count
Work Bike 976 122 1498 124 2014 134
Other Bike – 0 – 4 239 21
Mtn Bike – 5 77 12 – –
Run 311 54 163 41 230 42
Trail Run – 0 – 5 51 6
Hike – 2 – 12 65 7
Snow – 1 0 12 – –
Other – 1 3 9 3 8
Nada – 208 0 153 – –
Total
(not nada)		 1287 184 1751 219 2601 218

Some points of embarrassment:

  • The 1 snowboarding was actually on the 30th of December this year i.e. last week
  • Mountain biking took a beating and there were only 4 Tiger rides this year and no Epics
  • The shorter work bike ride is really taking it’s toll on the mileage – although the ride count was barely down I’m now less than half the 2005 mileage on my commute (in 2005 Other Bike was mountain biking and non-work biking combined)
  • Green for 208 nada’s is really misleading….

And for the final tidbit – the bike stats: the Volpe had 62 commutes to the 925’s 57 (with the Trek Fuel mountain bike picking up 3 emergency rides), which says more about how bad the weather is in Seattle as this year than true bike preference – I’ve only had the Volpe set up with fenders all year. But this year the Volpe wins, so it’s a year apiece for the Volpe/925 face-off. (Last year: after buying the 925 the ride split was 48 vs. 32 for the Redline.)

item.title: 2006 Activity Zeitgeist
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: Similar to last year’s What did you do in 2005? here is my compilation from Excel of my activities in 2006. Many of you will be glad to see that I did nothing on 153 days – almost half the year! I did approximately 372 activities, which means I double-dipped on only 7 days, which … Continue reading "2006 Activity Zeitgeist"
item.content:encoded:
Similar to last year’s What did you do in 2005? here is my compilation from Excel of my activities in 2006.

Many of you will be glad to see that I did nothing on 153 days – almost half the year! I did approximately 372 activities, which means I double-dipped on only 7 days, which is pretty low (i.e. I basically never did a bike to work *and* something else). I’ve made a funky little pie chart showing the overview:

I would like to make a claim that I didn’t log a long summer and autumn of doing regular evening “pregnancy walks” with Danika, but really, they didn’t count anyway.

Side notes: I only went to the gym once (for ski conditioning), our hiking was mostly compressed into August (getting ready for vacation) and then September (the vacation), 11 out of my 12 mountain bike rides were at Tiger, and for the first time I snowboarded the same amount as a I mountain biked. Justifying not buying a new mountain bike but the new on-sale snowboarding kit quite nicely. Apart from gym and basketball all of my activities were outside which I like.

In terms of the new bike (Redline 925) I rode it 48 times compared to the Volpe’s 76, but 44 of the Volpe’s rides had been before I had the 925. So since purchase the rides have been 48 vs. 32. Redline 925 wins.

Finally, moving job seriously reduced my work miles on the bike: from 16 to 9 a day, and I really feel the lack of a critical mass in the shorter commute.

  2006 Miles 2006 Count 2005 Miles 2005 Count
Bike (no data) 4 239 21
Work Bike 1498 124 2014 134
Hike (no data) 12 65 7
Run 163 41 230 42
Trail Run (bad data) 5 51 6
Nada 0 153 (no data) (no data)
Mtn Bike 77 12 (no data) (no data)
Snowboard 0 12 (no data) (no data)
Other 3 9 3 8
Total 1751 372 2601 218

Looking at the comparison, the only big difference this year is that I split “bike” into non-work road biking (4) and mountain biking (12). The bike (21) from last year combined these (although was mostly mountain biking).

Updated 28th Dec 07: fixed the titles to 2006/2005 instead of 2007/2006

item.title: That was the last week
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: It’s the New Year now, but I thought I’d finish up my 2006 Activity Log. Given I only had three work days and commuted them all I think I did ok. Mon (25th): nada, except eating Christmas food Tue: nada Wed: bike to/from work Thu: bike to/from work Fri: bike to/from work Sat: nada Sun … Continue reading "That was the last week"
item.content:encoded:
It’s the New Year now, but I thought I’d finish up my 2006 Activity Log.

Given I only had three work days and commuted them all I think I did ok.

Mon (25th): nada, except eating Christmas food
Tue: nada
Wed: bike to/from work
Thu: bike to/from work
Fri: bike to/from work
Sat: nada
Sun (31st): Snowboarding at Baker (weehee!)

I’m not planning on logging all activities in 2007 – too many stories of sleepless nights will be involved in the excuses.

Be active.

item.title: Zero Level Achieved
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description: Following my warm-down last week, I did nada this week. You could blame it on being busy at home, but it’s really not true as it was the first week in months that most nights weren’t booked out. You could blame it on floods and storms, and I’m sure if I was planning on doing … Continue reading "Zero Level Achieved"
item.content:encoded:
Following my warm-down last week, I did nada this week.

You could blame it on being busy at home, but it’s really not true as it was the first week in months that most nights weren’t booked out.

You could blame it on floods and storms, and I’m sure if I was planning on doing anything then that would be valid.

You could blame it on doing decorating at home, but then I never count that as exercise anyway.

Nope, pretty much just lazy. By intention. Although the pounds are going on and I can’t be bad forever.

Indeed I biked to work today.

Mon (11th Dec): nada
Tue: nada
Wed: nada
Thu: nada
Fri: nada
Sat: nada
Sun: nada

item.title: Can I be less active?

Clearly the answer is yes, but I’m working my way down gracefully.

item.content:encoded:
There are some photos over at flickr, although I stole a few for aphotoperday.

I haven’t bothered detailing kick-about soccer, yard basketball or my first pick-up American Football experience, so the activity log looks pretty dull for last week all in all.

Mon (20th): bike to/from work
Tue: nada – no excuse
Wed: nada – going to Chicago
Thu: nada – burp
Fri: nada – leftovers
Sat: nada – in Chicago proper
Sun: nada – coming home
